wizard.descrizione:
Welcome to Monithon's Project Finder!
Here you can find out which projects are funded around you, track down the most interesting ones to monitor, view the essential information to start monitoring, create a report with your evaluation!
Where do you want to start?

categorie.20: Provision of water for human consumption
categorie.21: Water management and drinking water conservation
categorie.88: Risk prevention and management of non-climate related natural risks

projectFinder.htmlCosaPuoiFare:
• Search for publicly-funded projects in your city or neighborhood. Each dot is a project
  • Select projects filtering by theme, project category, budget, starting year, progress status.
  • Find out the projects on which a Civic Monitoring Report has already been published on Monithon
  • Scroll through the list of selected projects sorting them by distance, budget, theme and starting year
  • Read the summary of the project and its main characteristics
  • START MONITORING and access the Monithon workspace! There you will be able to find out all the details of the project and be guided step-by-step in drafting the Civic Monitoring Report.
projectFinder.htmlMetodologia:
• The data source for the projects funded by the Italian RFF plan is the ReGiS monitoring system managed by the Ministry of Economy and Finance. Data were downloaded from the governmental portal Italia Domani on June 13, 2023. Data on projects for daycare centers renovation are identified through the investment code M4C1I1.1.
  • The data source is the MEF-IGRUE National Monitoring System, published as open data on the OpenCoesione governmental portal.
  • The projects financed by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) 2014-2020
  • The projects classified by OpenCoesione in the following 'synthetic themes' have been included: Environment, Energy, Culture and Tourism. Sustainable mobility projects were also added, considering the 'fields of intervention' 43 and 44.
  • The geographical position derives from the geo-referencing of the addresses of the projects present in the Monitoring System (if not present, the project was located in the center of the municipality). National and regional level projects are excluded.
  • Data update is as of December 31, 2020
projectFinder.sottotitolo: Discover publicly funded projects around you!
projectFinder.cosaPuoiFare: A few things you can do

reportFinder.htmlCosaPuoiFare:
• Discover the civic monitoring reports in your region, city or district. Each dot is a report. Each color corresponds to project effectiveness, as evaluated by the civic group that carried out the monitoring.
  • Select the reports by filtering by theme, Operational Programme, budget, year of monitoring, programming cycle.
  • Scroll through the list of selected reports sorting them by distance, budget, evaluation and date of monitoring
  • Read the summary of the monitored project and access the Civic Monitoring Report
reportFinder.sottotitolo: Discover civic monitoring reports on publicly funded projects by students, civic communities and associations.
reportFinder.cosaPuoiFare: A few things you can do
